title: Spectra - emit two photons from initial -1eV level

content.question: The diagram shows the energy levels of a hypothetical atom with a ground-state energy of <math alttext="negative 9 electron volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>eV</mtext></math>. The atom is excited to the <math alttext="negative 1 electron volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>eV</mtext></math> energy level and then makes two separate transitions, emitting two photons. Which of the following could be the energy of one of the two photons?
